summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to Judge Berman's chambers, with copies to defense counsel, submitting the Government's letter motion requesting court approval of a proposed order of nolle prosequi (dismissal) in the case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the government's motion for nolle prosequi in the Epstein case, indicating he is part of the defense counsel.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the government's motion for nolle prosequi in the Epstein case, indicating he is part of the defense counsel.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The email is addressed to his chambers regarding a motion in the case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), which he is presiding over.

connections.description: Both are copied as defense counsel on the government's motion in the Epstein case, indicating they are part of the same defense team.
Judge Berman is the presiding judge in the case where Weinberg is defense counsel, as indicated in the case caption and email.
Judge Berman is the presiding judge in the case where Miller is defense counsel, as indicated in the case caption and email.

events.title: Government Files Motion for Nolle Prosequi
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York files a letter motion requesting the court approve an order of nolle prosequi (dismissal) in the case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490.

keyFacts: On August 19, 2019, the Government filed a motion requesting court approval for an order of nolle prosequi (dismissal) in the criminal case U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).
The motion was submitted by an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York to Judge Berman's chambers.
Defense counsel Martin Weinberg and Michael Miller were copied on the correspondence.
The case referenced is the 2019 federal criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein, which was pending before Judge Richard M. Berman at the time.
